required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Study on Clinical Performance of Screw-retained Implant Crowns
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Performance of One-piece Screw-retained Implant Crowns Base on CAD/CAM Hand-veneered Zirconium Dioxide Customized Abutments With a 6 Years and 7 Months Mean Follow-up

brief_summary.textblock:
Survival and success rates of all-ceramic implant-supported fixed reconstructions fabricated with CAD/CAM technology after at least one year in function.
Survival and success rates (clinical, radiologic and esthetic) of all-ceramic implant-supported fixed reconstructions fabricated with CAD/CAM technology after 2 to 10 years in function.
Establishment of a database of patients with all-ceramic implant-supported fixed reconstructions fabricated with CAD/CAM technology for future longitudinal retrospective studies.

primary_outcome.measure: Survival and success rates of all-ceramic implant-supported fixed reconstructions
primary_outcome.description: Number of all-ceramic implant-supported fixed reconstructions fabricated with CAD/CAM technology still in place after at least one year in function.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with biological complications assessed via clinical examination
secondary_outcome.description: A clinical evaluation of the implant crowns will be performed in order to detect any kind of biological complication, namely periimplantitis and perimucositis

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with biological complications assessed via periapical x-ray
secondary_outcome.description: A radiological evaluation of the implant crowns will be performed to measure and evaluate the bone crestal changes

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with technical complications
secondary_outcome.description: A clinical evaluation of the implant crowns will be performed in order to detect any kind of complication, namely chipping, screw loosening or abutment fracture

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction as assessed by VAS A
secondary_outcome.description: Patients assess by patient questionnaire their implant reconstructions, in terms of function by means of a Visual Analog Scale (VAS A), where the parameter will be scored from 1 to 10.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction as assessed by VAS B
secondary_outcome.description: Patients assess by patient questionnaire their implant reconstructions, in terms of esthetics by means of a Visual Analog Scale (VAS B), where the parameter will be scored from 1 to 10.

The esthetic examination included the Pink and White Esthetic Score Assessment (PES/WES) according to Belser et al. 2009 & Furh√§user et al. 2005 on a scale from 0-10 whereas 10 means an optimal outcome.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with at least one fixed all-ceramic reconstruction (single implant restoration on BL implant with individualized zirconia abutment directly screwed and directly veneered, three- to five-unit zirconia bridges directly veneered, single tooth crown made of a lithium disilicate glass-ceramic (LS2) blank)
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy at the time of the follow-up examination
- Mental handicap
- Patients that could not be contacted/located
- Patients not interested in participating
- Patients with the need of antibiotic prophylaxis prior to a clinical examination
